an10.32:3.1: 32 Suspending the Recitation of the Code of Conduct
an10.32:4.1: “Sir, how many grounds are there to suspend the recitation of the code of conduct?”
an10.32:4.2: “Upāli, there are ten grounds to suspend the recitation of the code of conduct.
an10.32:4.4: A mendicant who has committed an expulsion offence is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone has committed an expulsion offence is unfinished. A person who is not fully ordained is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone is fully ordained or not is unfinished. Someone who has abandoned the training is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone has abandoned the training or not is unfinished. A eunuch is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether someone is a eunuch is unfinished. A raper of nuns is sitting in the assembly. A discussion about whether or not someone is a raper of nuns is unfinished.
an10.32:4.5: These are the ten grounds to suspend the recitation of the code of conduct.”
